title: Who's laughing now? The Skoda worth a million pounds
text:
It’s no laughing matter – for decades Skoda cars were the butt of endless automotive jokes. Now a newly restored example in the Czech Republic is valued at more than many modern supercars.

The Laurin & Klement type BSC is a two-seater sports car dating back to 1908. Just 12 open-top models were hand-built and the gleaming white example is believed to be the only one left in existence.

Skoda founders Vaclav Laurin and Vaclav Klement started business in bicycle manufacture in 1895. Their first car was the affordable Voiturette with a top speed of 25mph. It proved so popular that production ramped up from a few dozen machines in 1906 to nearly 500 in 1908.

The BS model followed, equipped with a...
description: It’s no laughing matter – for decades Skoda cars were the butt of endless automotive jokes.
